solution.text:
Amount of water in the bottle originally = _{j}_ litres
Portion of _{j}_ litres of water consumed by Chirag = \( \frac 35\)
Thus, amount of water Chirag consumed = \( \frac 35 \times _{j}_ \) litres = \( _{{Fraction(3*j, 5)}}_\) litres

content.text: Vishal went on a picnic with his friend Chirag. They carried a water bottle that contained _{j}_ litres of water. Chirag consumed \( \frac 35^{th} \) of the water and Vishal consumed the remaining. How much water did Chirag Drink ?
